attributes.action: Do not allow universities to raise tuition fees from £9000 to the proposed £9250
attributes.background: Universities announce fees above £9,000 limit - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-36845106

attributes.action: Independent review on which voting system delivers the greatest representation.
attributes.background: The current First Past the Post voting system is delivering Governments voted for by the largest minority of voters, not the majority, but there are disagreements over which system would deliver the greatest representation, AV. AV+, STV, PR. An independent review is needed to answer this question.
attributes.additional_details:
More information on the different types of voting systems can be found on the internet, once site being
http://www.electoral-reform.org.uk/voting-systems
Many other Countries use different systems, Scotland uses the STV system for its local elections.

attributes.action: Call a General Election that allows 16-17 year old people to vote.
attributes.background: The next PM is unelected this is not democratic, an election should have happened when Gordon Brown took office don't allow this to happen again. 16 and 17 year olds are competent and understand that their vote can make a difference and so should be allowed to vote.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.electoral-reform.org.uk/votes-at-16
http://www.voteat16.ie/nine_reasons
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/lord-wallace/eu-referendum-young-voters_b_8280774.html

After all a 16-year-old in Britain can get married, pay tax and join the army, so why on earth should they not be allowed to take part in the democratic process, especially when it involves a decision that greatly affects them?

attributes.action: Make Government time immediately available to repeal Expats 15 year voting limit
attributes.background: In the recent Referendum vote, many British subjects were prevented from voting on a matter which could potentially affect their lives because they have lived and worked abroad for more than 15 years. Government time is needed in Parliament immediately to enable a promise by David Cameron to be kept
attributes.additional_details: The Rt Hon David Cameron recently stated that there was an intention to repeal this limit but no time was available before the Referendum. Since the "Leave" vote will compel a new programme of legislation when Parliament returns after Recess an opportunity exists to progress this. A Bill was introduced by Geoffrey Clifton-Brown MP in 2014 but failed for lack of time despite strong Conservative support. This should be immediately reintroduced in Government time not by a Private Member

attributes.action: Award of a National Defence Medal
attributes.background: I propose an award of a National Defence Medal to all serving and ex- serving members of HM Forces in recognition of the service that they have given/give to their country and to the people, subject to meeting certain criteria.
attributes.additional_details:
Not everyone was able to go into a war like zone but they nevertheless gave 100% effort.

Please recognise their efforts.

http://nationaldefencemedal.webs.com/Submission%20for%20the%20UK%20National%20Defence%20Medal.pdf

attributes.action: Give all 16 and 17 year olds the vote in referenda that affect their future
attributes.background: In the June 2016 referendum on whether to remain in the UK, 16 and 17 year old citizens have been denied a say on this important question, yet will endure its consequences for the next 60 to 70 years. Their fate has been decided by older people who have less at stake. This is morally wrong.

attributes.action: Allow EU citizens who are resident in the UK to vote in any future UK referendum
attributes.background: In the recent 2016 UK referendum, EU citizens that had been living AND working in the UK for more than 5 years were unable to vote on a referendum that would directly affect their lives. These people are net contributors, both economically and socially to the UK and should not be devalued.

attributes.action: Allow tax-paying UK residents to vote in general elections and referendums
attributes.background:
Excluding tax paying immigrants from the voting population makes the vote less representative of the will of the UK because it silences a very important part of the engine of the country.
Let's make sure going forward all the people who love and work hard for this country have a say in its future.

attributes.action: Hold a public enquiry into the legitimacy of the result of the EU Referendum.
attributes.background: The EU Referendum vote to leave the EU will make an irreversible change to the UK’s relationship to the rest of world. Remain and Leave campaigns, and unofficial campaigns, mislead the public on key factual information about our current and future relationship with the EU and the rest of the world.
attributes.additional_details:
We have a principal in the UK that we are not allowed to gain advantage by knowingly lying. Yet that is what has happened with the EU referendum. Both campaigns made statements that were not true.

The Leave campaign has achieved a narrow victory and we are now told that their main campaign promise “We send the EU £350 million a week let’s fund the NHS instead” is not possible.

We need an enquiry into the legitimacy of the result that is based on lies  by both campaigns to acquire support.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to pull out of selling a property once the sale had been agreed.
attributes.background: My wife and I are trying to buy our  first home. We have agreed to buy three different properties and the sellers ended up backing out on all three occasions. This is extremely upsetting and frustrating. This is not legal in other countries, so why should it be here? Home buyers should be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
Almost everyone we know who had bought a home had this happen at least once. This is a huge problem and unfair for those trying to buy a home. 

The seller can pull out of the sale at any time until contracts have been exchanged. The buyer can have spent lots of money before this and up losing hundreds, if not thousands,  of pounds. 

In Scotland, once a sale has been agreed, then the sellers must go ahead. 

The law on this country should be changed to save home buyers from this heartache.

attributes.action: Stop street beggars from using live animals to support their begging.
attributes.background:
All over London's West End tourist spots there are gangs of Eastern Europeans using dogs to aid their begging.
The dogs are dressed up in clothes, hats and sunglasses, and are made to to sit out in all weathers for hours to attract the public and encourage them to give money.

attributes.action: Replace religious education in UK schools with a comparative history of religion
attributes.background: Religion can be the cause of social and educational schism.
attributes.additional_details: School is our first experience of institutional life and so, as a priority, it should be inclusive and harmonised from the outset. Religion is used in our schools as a context to teach ethics. A Comparative History of Religion will foster objectivity and tolerance, which are themselves virtuous. A Comparative History of Religion will produce an empirical lesson in social harmony that is psychologically wholesome, undeniable and therefore enduring.

attributes.action: Reconsider changing bursaries to loans for Student Nurses and Midwives.
attributes.background: The government has recently voted to remove the NHS Bursary for Student Nurses and Midwives. Student Nurses and midwives work 37.5 per hours a week on placement, they should not have to pay for the privilege of becoming nurses, when they already work for that money!

attributes.action: Extend the timetable for district councils to submit their Local plans
attributes.background: Plans based their housing numbers on several factors (migration, economic growth, etc). The data supporting these factors may no longer be valid given the significant risks that have emerged post BREXIT. Councils should be required to review the risks and reconfirm their housing requirements.

attributes.action: Include all armed services veterans on the 2021 census
attributes.background: Our armed services form a historical and vital part of our community. Although the service records are there we just do not know how many veterans are still with us or where. This would help the Government to plan and possibly allocate resources to areas with a high veteran population.
attributes.additional_details: By including veterans into the census this would bring to the veterans a sense that they are really valued by us all.

attributes.action: Offer financial support for students who have had to defer for medical reasons.
attributes.background: If a full time university student has to defer the course due to medical reasons, there are no provisions in place to prevent them from becoming homeless or to access financial support. Many students defer each year and are forced to give up their education in order to claim state benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
Department for Work and Pensions regulations do not consider deferred students, even if they are signed off sick by their GP. 

Housing benefit do not consider deferred students even if they have dependent children. 

Student Finance England can only provide up to 60 days worth of funding if you provide adequate evidence for the reason why you've had to defer. 

Universities have grants for those in hardship but have a yearly allowance. You cannot go over this limit under any circumstances.

attributes.action: Outlaw packaging materials unsuitable for recycling, such as foil-backed plastic
attributes.background: It is commonplace for manufacturing and retail to create hybrid packaging materials that are unsuitable for recycling.
attributes.additional_details:
An everyday example is the foil-backed plastic often used for crisp packets. Although plastic is now commonly accepted for recycling in household waste collection, crisp packets are not. The foil is bound to the plastic in a way that makes it impossible for our recycling processes to be used. 

In a world increasingly concerned about the environment, we need strict legislation ensuring all manufactured packaging materials are as recyclable as possible.

attributes.action: Move parliament away from the Palace of Westminster to Carlisle, Cumbria
attributes.background: London-centric government leads to a distorted view of the UK and a disproportionate distribution of resource. The Northern Power House discussion mistakenly sees the Merseyside/Manchester/Leeds axis as the North of England. Government from Carlisle will shift more than just the base of politics.
attributes.additional_details: The problems of poor infrastructure, transport and communication can be ignored while the British Government continues to rule from Westminster. The North East has at least reasonable transport links; Cumbria boasts two lane trunk roads. Much of Cumbria has poor mobile signal and even poorer broadband.  What might change if the Government had to try to function in that environment.  This time Cumbria, after 10 years perhaps another northern county, then perhaps Cornwall!

attributes.action: Make it illegal to sell lilies without a clear label stating they kill cats.
attributes.background: Lilies are among one of the most common flowers sold in the UK. They are also toxic and fatal to the most common pet in the UK: cats. They are so lethal to cats that even just a cat brushing passed a lily and catching some pollen on its fur and then licking it off will shut down a cat's kidneys.
attributes.additional_details: My 8 month old cat passed away by coming into contact with a lily. She was in intensive care for two days, her kidneys shut down, she was aggressively twitching, she could not move and as her kidneys could not process and remove her potassium levels she died of a heart attack. All it takes is a cat to ingest the tiniest bit of pollen and they will die. How can it be that all lilies sold do not come with a clear warning? It is disgusting. I lost my sweet young girl, don't let this happen again.

attributes.action: Make gender/sexuality a compulsory topic in PSHEE/P&E lessons in UK high schools
attributes.background: Many genders and sexualities are unheard of by most people, meaning it is difficult for those questioning to find a label which describes them. I think introducing a gender and sexuality topic in PSHEE/P&E classes in all high schools would assist those questioning and lessen homophobia in schools.
attributes.additional_details: Although the statistic for LGBT+ students is estimated, around 1 in 5 students are believed to be a part of the community. This means that approximately 646,900 students are LGBT+ and would benefit from this topic, as well as the remainder of students who will be more educated and aware of the many genders and sexualities there are.

attributes.action: Pressurise Russia to stop targeting civilians in Syria.
attributes.background: We demand the UK Government use its international powers and standing in order to pressurise Russia so as to end the deliberate targeting of civilians and civilian infrastructure in Syria, as well as to negotiate access routes with Turkey, for medics and medical supplies to Syria.
attributes.additional_details:
-1557 civilian victims in July 2016 alone
- Over 1,000 deaths at the hands of the Regime and Russian forces.
- 25 medics and civil defense personnel dead in July 2016, alone
- Russia has killed more civilians than ISIS or Assad

"despicable pattern of unlawful attacks deliberately targeting medical facilities (Amnesty International, 2016)."

https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2016/07/syria-fatal-airstrike-on-maternity-hospital-a-potential-war-crime/

http://sn4hr.org/blog/2016/08/06/25347/

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/syria-war-aleppo-news-latest-air-strikes-children-civilians-killed-bombing-hospital-market-russia-a7187356.html

https://www.facebook.com/liveupdatesfromsyria/?fref=nf

http://www.iamsyria.org/death-tolls-july-2016.html

attributes.action: NHS to change the term Mental Health to Personal Health to get rid of the stigma
attributes.background: Many people take their own lives through depression and various psychological health issues. The term "Mental" creates a huge stigma and fear for many people who feel if they see someone from a mental health service then it will affect them later for work etc.
attributes.additional_details:
People believe that if you see a mental health specialist then your classed as a mental health patient and fear of being sectioned sets in. By changing this term we can hopefully have more lives saved by letting people feel more relaxed about their personal health issues and maybe they will find the strength to speak out.
From personal experience i was worried about driving into a mental health unit after suffering depression. i then asked for an alternative venue to have my meetings.

attributes.action: Stop children convicted of serious offences from attending mainstream schools
attributes.background: The current legislative framework MUST be reviewed to ensure those committing the most serious offences such as stabbing another child cannot return to mainstream school, putting the safety of children & teachers at risk
attributes.additional_details: There MUST be a minimum period of monitoring and psychological assessment within a specialist unit before offenders are reintegrated, irrespective of the number of previous exclusions a child has.  Disruptive behaviour currently carries the same punishment as stabbing.

attributes.action: Provide food, shelter, rehabilitation and caring for every homeless person
attributes.background:
The homeless situation in Britain is a terrible stain on our home nations.  Having anybody living on the streets in such a developed society is deplorable.

To let it happen because it is felt that people have fell through the cracks, don't try or have chosen their misfortune is unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
It is estimated that as much as 25% of homeless people are ex service personal.

People in derived areas are doubly jeopardised by not having life chances of an affluent, structured, stable upbringing and are more susceptible to finding themselves on the fringes of society.

This is the age of one nation Britain and we need to care and nurture all.

We would like to see Parliament open up homeless rehabilitation centres to be able to accommodate everybody on the streets, to get their life back

attributes.action: Reinstate the 2006 plan for all new homes built after 2016 to be zero carbon.
attributes.background: The plan would have ensured that all new dwellings from 2016 would generate as much energy on-site – via renewable sources, e.g. wind or solar energy – as they would use in heating, hot water, lighting and ventilation. This would be alongside tighter energy efficiency standards.
attributes.additional_details:
Zero Carbon homes are not more expensive - designers at Cardiff University built a zero carbon house at no extra cost here: (http://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-33544831). Also, they will be cheaper to run as energy costs could be zero or even negative, therefore earning the owners money.
As well as the economic benefits of zero carbon homes, reducing carbon emissions is also important for climate change; and reducing energy dependency on other countries (i.e. by importing gas and oil)

attributes.action: Raise the student maintenance loan in Cambridge to match the London living costs
attributes.background: Living costs in Cambridge have considerably increased in the past 3 years. Yet, the loans given to students do not reflect this increase in the same way as they do for London students. The average rent for student accommodation in Cambridge is so high that currently loans do not cover the majority.

attributes.action: Do not trigger Article 50 until second EU referendum.
attributes.background: The current divide following 1st EU referendum means that the population is not represented at all, and the campaign was based on misleading information.

attributes.action: Referendum for the people to decide whether we should end the TV License Fee/Tax
attributes.background: The BBC coverage of the UK Referendum has not been free of political bias. Whether it comes to BBC News reporting, prominently featuring Remain side arguments and showing Leave side arguments playing second fiddle to the BBC Website which has done the same. As for the BBC Fact Checker that is biased

attributes.action: Bring back A-level resits!
attributes.background: We want to bring back A-level resits for alll students across the UK. We want to be able to make sure you can resit your AS year and/or A2 year. It will enable students to have access to a second opportunity and allow them to attend University instead of missing out on the chance to prevail in life.
attributes.additional_details: By bringing back the AS/A2 resits, students will have the opportunity to achieve their highest aspirations in life instead of being set back due to one bad grade.

attributes.action: Rename the RRS Sir David Attenborough to RRS Boaty McBoatface
attributes.background: Britain is known worldwide for both it's excellent scientific research and sense of humour. NERC should accept the choice of RRS Boaty McBoatface (124,109 votes), rather than for RRS Sir David Attenborough (10,284 votes) and respect the true democratic result and excellent British wit.

attributes.action: To Issue National Identity Cards for everyone to protect our National Security.
attributes.background: With the ongoing threat to our borders and security, it is time to introduce a National Identity Card. This must be issued to all UK citizens and to all successful immigration applicants and should be carried at all times. This is a necessary step forward assist our Police and Immigration services.
attributes.additional_details: The refusal of the Government and the opposition of those who defend their privacy, are undermining the security and safety of the majority of people who wish to protect the UK and have nothing to hide!

attributes.action: Bring back national service for school leavers who do not wish to further educat
attributes.background: It would be good for national service to be brought back as it would help lower unemployment help to teach new skills giving them a good start to there working life also it would meen if more people are in work more money will be getting spent in shops ect

attributes.action: Call for Government to fund rural school transport
attributes.background: we call for the government to fund all rural home to school transport across the country instead of local councils being responsible for setting their own privatized school bus services, which is causing financial hardship to working families, and severe disruption to public services.
attributes.additional_details: local councils have been given responsibility for setting school bus services, which has allowed them to privatize the bus routes and hike up the prices to almost £1000 per child,per year in some cases. This is causing severe financial hardship to low income families who do not qualify now under the new 'nearest school' changes, as opposed to the old 'catchment school' agreement.we would like all children to travel to school for free, all current school bus services also need improvement.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory at all schools to have a time dedicated for napping.
attributes.background: A recent NASA study revealed that a 20 minute nap boosted cognition by almost 40%. Therefore in order for a students to fully focus throughout their school day the government should urge schools to set apart a time of day for sleep. Schools could provide dark rooms or pods for sleep only.

attributes.action: Properly fund the NHS and scrap the proposed STP programme.
attributes.background: The UK spends less on health as a share of its GDP than most other G7 countries. Our NHS is under pressure as never before and is in danger of failure. The NHS is effectively only getting an increase of 0.95% per year. The STP programme will close A&E's and essential services across the country.
attributes.additional_details:
Spending on health compared to other countries:
http://www.kingsfund.org.uk/projects/nhs-in-a-nutshell/health-care-spending-compared

Effective increase of 0.95% per year for the NHS:
http://www.kingsfund.org.uk/projects/nhs-in-a-nutshell/nhs-budget

Draft sustainability and transformation plans (STPs) which propose ward closures, cuts in bed numbers and changes to A&E and GP care in 44 areas:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-37186455

attributes.action: Make it law for all horse riders to wear hi-viz clothing when riding on the road
attributes.background:
As a horse rider, nothing infuriates me more than other riders who risk themselves and their horses by hacking on roads not wearing hi-viz. 
We expect drivers and other road users to slow down when passing us so we should make sure we can be seen well in advance.
attributes.additional_details:
Wearing hi-viz increases visibility by seconds. 
By not wearing it riders increase the risk of accident.

Be safe, be seen!

attributes.action: Legalise use of medical marijuana for chronic pain (and other conditions)
attributes.background:
Myself (and many others in the UK) struggle daily with chronic pain and other painful problems out of our control.

Why should patients suffer major side effects from pain meds meaning they are unable to function normally in day to day life leading to job insecurity, and reducing their dignity.
attributes.additional_details:
"Almost 10 million Britons suffer pain almost daily resulting in a major impact on their quality of life and more days off work." - https://www.britishpainsociety.org/media-resources/

"Medical Marijuana Seems Safe for Chronic Pain" - http://www.webmd.com/pain-management/news/20151007/medical-marijuana-seems-safe-for-chronic-pain-patients-study-finds

"Cannabis use... better quality of life in patients with chronic pain." - http://www.jpain.org/article/S1526-5900(16)00567-8/abstract

attributes.action: Allow NON-EU parents/ family members of British Citizens to settle in UK.
attributes.background:
Following my dad's terminal illness, my family (I, my wife & son) relocated to India in 2014 to look after my dad & support my mum.
Since I have lost my dad, we want to return home (London) but I can't leave my elderly mum (who has already gone through a lot since 2012) on her own in India.
attributes.additional_details:
I, my wife & son are UK Citizens. We own a house in London & had decent jobs in financial service industry until we moved our center of life to India in Apr'14.
Following my dad's demise, I'm desperate to return to our home in London but are forced to stay in India as UK won't let my mum in to settle & I can't leave her alone!  UK allows non EU family of EU immigrants under EU law but can't do the same for it's own citizens. Is this the price we have to pay for being UK citizens & tax payers?

attributes.action: Hold an all-party public inquiry into bullying and harassment in Parliament
attributes.background:
Recent difficulties in relations between MP's in the Labour Party have highlighted an endemic culture of bullying within HoC.

Bullying & harassment aren't accepted in any other workplace or institution in the UK. This toxic culture is harming individuals and politics more widely.
attributes.additional_details:
MP reduced to tears watching personal attacks at Labour leader designed to "Break him as a man": http://tinyurl.com/zl268n5

Some of these MPs have since stated they felt extreme pressure to vote "no confidence" in the leader

Conservative MPs have spoken out against bullying behaviour and how ineffective current anti-bullying measures are: http://tinyurl.com/z8se6nz

We need

* Full inquiry into bullying into HoC
* Measures to bring protection for MPs and HoC staff in line with other workplaces

attributes.action: an amendment to the Weights and Measures Act 1985 to allow Pound and Ounces.
attributes.background:
We the undersigned would like to be able to buy and sell goods in Pounds and Ounces. All it would take is a small amendment to the Weights and Measures Act 1985 to allow us to buy and sell goods in Pound and Ounces.  



This is a Zider Party campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
To sell goods in pounds and ounces was made illegally by the weights and measures Act 1985.

All we ask is for a small amendment to the Weight and Measures Act 1985 to allow us to use pounds and ounces to buy and sells goods.

attributes.action: Change the law to make the result of referendums in the UK legally binding.
attributes.background: Referendums held in the UK are not currently legally enforceable and parliament is under no duty to enact their results. MPs are elecred by the will of the people to represent the people, as such they must comply democratically with the demands of the people.
attributes.additional_details: From time to time UK Governments hold referendums. Regardless of the outcome, the government is under no legal obligation to accept the outcome. This is entirely undemocratic and must change.

attributes.action: All Public & Committee meetings in Council & Government should be Live-Streamed
attributes.background: To further the interests of transparency and openness, a presumption should be made to Live-Stream all meetings that affect people's lives, so no official or elected representative can hide behind anonymity and we, as citizens, will no longer be deceived or have communications  "spun".
attributes.additional_details: Where there is no risk of compromise to individuals or families, the presumption must be that all public or committee meetings should be live-streamed so citizens have less reason to distrust politicians or civil servants. If there is nothing to hide, there is nothing to fear is what we are told by government agencies concerned with surveillance and monitoring, so the same should apply to government. The United Kingdom should be a world leader in "glasnost" not forever in the shadows.

attributes.action: Provides refuge in the UK for our armed forces interpreters in all war zones
attributes.background: I served for 30 years in the RAF, I completed my service for my country in 2005. To read that the country I served for, is hanging out to dry, even signing the death warrant of those brave local people, and their families who assisted our personnel in recent war zones deeply upsets me.
attributes.additional_details:
Trade                    Aircraft Avionics
Rank                     Chief Technician
Last Posting         RAF Cosford

attributes.action: Make Climate Change education a compulsory aspect of the UK national curriculum.
attributes.background: Climate change is arguably the most complex problem ever faced by humanity and the consequences of inaction will be most felt by our children. The fact that this information is not delivered in our schools with urgency is unacceptable and we are letting all future generations down!
attributes.additional_details:
How can we expect to encourage global collaboration and eco-innovation in the UK's future if our children are not even aware of this serious problem? Human induced climate change cannot be ignored any more. We are letting our children/country/planet down by not encouraging active debate on this issue in our schools. 
Current curricula: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/national-curriculum. 
IPCC Climate Report: http://ipccwg2.gov/AR5/images/uploads/WG2AR5_SPM_FINAL.pdf

attributes.action: Make the parent receiving child maintenance provide receipts to remain eligible
attributes.background: Fathers and Mothers paying child maintenance should have proof that the money is being spent on their child/children and not funding the receiving parents social life or any other activities that do not directly benefit the children involved.
attributes.additional_details: My own personal case has seen me paying child maintenance for 4 years and I am yet to see any benefit it has had for my children. If by law the receiving parent had to provide receipts to show that the money received had been spent on the children and not on themselves then the majority of children in child maintenance cases would be better off as they would get 100% of the money spent on them.

attributes.action: Create a law that new buildings must have roofs covered in solar panels/plants.
attributes.background: Partially covering roofs with solar panels would help to reduce the building's carbon footprint. The plants would be used on roofs which don't face south. The plants would produce oxygen and also reduce the amount of energy needed to heat or cool a building and also create a place for birds to nest.
attributes.additional_details:
Similar laws have been put in place in San Fransisco and France. It is more cost effective to do this on new buildings than retrofit existing buildings.
For more information:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/mar/20/france-decrees-new-rooftops-must-be-covered-in-plants-or-solar-panels

https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/apr/21/san-francisco-adopts-law-requiring-solar-panels-on-all-new-buildings

attributes.action: Stop the production of the 1 pence coins.
attributes.background:
The rate of inflation has made 1 pence coins virtually unusable. 
Canada has already removed its lowest value currency from circulation.
If the cost to produce one Canadian Penny is 1.5 Canadian Cents, then we can assume it has a similar cost in the UK.
It is uneconomical to keep in circulation.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/cost_to_produce_one_penny

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-21292441

attributes.action: Make pet shops pass a test before selling their animals
attributes.background: Many pet shops are giving the wrong advice about their animals, especially exotics, to first time owners and unfortunately they don't know it could be harming their pet. Pet shops should pass a test on each animal they sell to prevent this from happening.
attributes.additional_details:
The main issues are:
The wrong food 
Incorrect housing size/type
Incorrect size/type wheels (wire ones injure feet)
Telling people solitary animals "need a friend"
Incorrect bedding type (usually sawdust which is avoided by most people)
Failing to tell customers that CAPTIVE BRED ANIMALS SHOULD NOT BE RELEASED INTO THE WILD

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for recreational use by over 16s
attributes.background: Cannabis has been a Class B drug in the UK since 2009, meaning that it's illegal to sell, distribute, or use the drug in any way. However, millions of people throughout the UK still take advantage of cannabis for their recreational use, often turning to backstreet dealers who are making thousands.
attributes.additional_details:
If cannabis was commercially available in UK pharmacies & supermarkets, not only would British businesses profit massively, but the VAT attached would make millions of pounds for the UK economy, which could be spent on things such as a better-funded NHS & more modern facilities for our schools. 

Cannabis has often been branded as bad for one's health, when in reality, it often soothes anxiety; prevents glaucoma; and doesn't have a harmful effect on your organs like tobacco & alcohol can.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to direct hatred and abuse at any societal groups.
attributes.background: Racism and xenophobia have been legitimised in post-Brexit campaign Britain. We need to prevent extremist politicians, pressure groups and newspapers from inciting the hatred that has led to children being called 'vermin' and told to 'go home', and offensive slogans appearing in our cities.
attributes.additional_details: We would like Parliament to pass legislation making it illegal to target ANY group of people with hate messages, whether spoken, written or pictorial, so that politicians, pressure groups and newspapers can no longer use sensationalist headlines that scapegoat specific groups in society and make them a target for racism, xenophobia and other forms of hatred and abuse.
